meanings.definition: The state or quality of being troublesome.
meanings.sent1: Her constant troublesomenesses made it hard to relax.
meanings.sent2: The troublesomenesses of the situation were evident to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful troublesomenesses kept the family entertained.
meanings.sent4: The troublesomenesses of the storm left a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The troublesomenesses of the puzzle stumped even the experts.

meanings.definition: The tendency to cause difficulty or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: The child's troublesomenesses often led to tantrums.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with the troublesomenesses of technology can be frustrating.
meanings.sent3: The troublesomenesses of the broken toy made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The troublesomenesses of the traffic jam felt never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The troublesomenesses of the leaky faucet drove them to call a plumber.
